main event: On January 13, 1957, at 15:30 in Glenwood Springs, Colorado, a circular light the size of a small orange object was sighted moving at high speed in a straight course and disappeared after being visually observed for about 3-5 telescopes.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes.
One oval or circular UFO was observed, as depicted in a hand-drawn sketch in the document.
The source of the observation was noted as CIVIL AIR (CIG).
The object was established to have been a balloon released from Grand Junction at 03002, according to comments in the report.
The report does not contain any photographs of the observed object.
result: prosaic explanation - the object was identified as a balloon released from Grand Junction
sighted object: a circular light the size of a small orange object
